name: abc: transparent shields
title: abc: transparent shields
description:
- No shield - shows in 3rd person
## Step-by-Step Guide 1. **Open the Project Page** Visit the Modrinth, CurseForge, GitHub, or project website for the content you want to download. 2. **Find the Versions or Files Section** Look for a tab or section labelled **Versions**, **Files**, **Releases**, or **Downloads**. 3. **Select Your Minecraft Version** - Locate a list or dropdown called **Version**, **Game Version**, or **Supported Versions**. - Pick the version that matches your Minecraft installation (e.g., *1.20.1*, *1.19.2*). 4. **Choose the Correct File Type** The file type depends on the kind of content: - **Mods:** `.jar` - **Plugins:** `.jar` - **Addons (Bedrock):** `.mcaddon` / `.mcpack` - **Texture Packs:** `.zip` - **Data Packs:** `.zip` or extracted folder - **Capes / Skin Addons:** whichever format the creator provides 5. **Download the File** Click the **Download**, **Get**, or **File** button next to the version you need. Save the file to your device. 6. **Install According to Content Type** - **Mods:** place the `.jar` inside `.minecraft/mods`. - **Plugins:** move the `.jar` into your server’s `plugins` folder. - **Texture Packs:** place the `.zip` into `.minecraft/resourcepacks`. - **Data Packs:** put inside `world/datapacks`. - **Addons (Bedrock):** double-click `.mcaddon` or `.mcpack` to import automatically. 7. **Restart Minecraft or Your Server** Reload or restart to apply the new content.
short_description: Reduces or removes the shield view when equipped.
author: abcxyz

name: abc: modpack
title: abc: modpack
description:
![abc](https://cdn.modrinth.com/data/cached_images/69a3adf3c8405d6489dcd93c4e3cd99680fd5892.png)
A lightweight, modular collection of resource packs, datapacks, and mods from the ABC collection. Designed for simplicity, performance, and vanilla-friendly enhancements.

ABC is a collection-focused to high-quality, vanilla-friendly datapacks.
Design streamlined, modular additions that enhance Minecraft without breaking its core identity, this modpack is a home for all resource packs, mods, datapacks, and extras.


## ABC Mods Included
All ABC mods included in this modpack
|Mod|Description|Link|
|----|----|----|
|abc: low fire||[Link](https://modrinth.com/resourcepack/abc-lowfire)
|abc: gold title||[Link](https://modrinth.com/resourcepack/abc-gold-title)
|abc: transparent shields||[Link](https://modrinth.com/resourcepack/abc-transparent-shields)
|abc: no pumpkin||[Link](https://modrinth.com/resourcepack/abc-no-pumpkin)
|abc: recraftables [DEPRECATED]||[Link](https://modrinth.com/datapack/abc-recraftables)
|abc: capes||[Link](https://modrinth.com/resourcepack/abc-capes)
|abc: no world border||[Link](https://modrinth.com/resourcepack/abc-no-world-border)
|abc: crafting||[Link](https://modrinth.com/datapack/abc-crafting)
|abc: chromakey||[Link](https://modrinth.com/mod/abc-chromakey)
|abc: useless achievements||[Link](https://modrinth.com/datapack/abc-useless-achievements)

name: abc: recraftables [DEPRECATED]
title: abc: recraftables [DEPRECATED]
description: # This mod has been deprecated, please use [abc: crafting](https://modrinth.com/datapack/abc-crafting) - Adds the ability to craft uncraftable items in Minecraft - Removes some difficulty to the game ### Current items - Bell - Budding Amethyst - Cobweb - Calcite - Enchanted Golden Apple - Heart of the sea - Name Tag - Saddle - String - Spore blossom - Soul soil - Trident - Tuff - Bedrock - All Saplings - Ender Pearls - Command Block - Nether Star - Barrier - Elytra - Dead Bush - Totem of Undying ### Planned - All Ores - Horse Armour - Spawn Eggs - - Mushroom Block - Brown - Red ### Donate If you want to support me and my projects you can support me [here](https://github.com/sponsors/devvyyxyz/)
short_description: Makes some items and blocks easily easily gainable by adding new recipes and loot drops.
author: abcxyz

name: abc: useless achievements
title: abc: useless achievements
description:
![abc: useless achievements](https://cdn.modrinth.com/data/cached_images/d75c7b050ddf12e71722c38e7c09654e3c7c5e0a.png)
Adds useless achievements to the game by completing meaningless tasks


|Name|description|Requirments|Status|
|----|----|----|----|
|Dirt|dirting it up|
|Diamonds i think|These are diamonds i think...nevermind...|
|Weird dirt|This isnt dirt...|
|Stick collector|Obtain exactly one stick. Not two. One.|
|Bark enjoyer|Appreciate its texture|
|Grass whisperer|have a single grass block (the tall grass, not the dirt). Listen closely.|
|Moo|Enter the mushroom fields biome|
|It's bitter|Eat a mushroom of both types|
|Rock sniffer|Acquire a cobblestone and pretend it's fascinating|
|Leaf inspector|Study the complex life-cycle of a leaf. Very scientific|
|Jumping for no reason|N/A|N/A|N/A|

![In game achievements tab](https://cdn.modrinth.com/data/cached_images/1c64ecd68bf14da2a717dac92a9cec67601ddc0a_0.webp)


## Step-by-Step Guide

1. **Open the Project Page**  
   Visit the Modrinth, CurseForge, GitHub, or project website for the content you want to download.

2. **Find the Versions or Files Section**  
   Look for a tab or section labelled **Versions**, **Files**, **Releases**, or **Downloads**.

3. **Select Your Minecraft Version**  
   - Locate a list or dropdown called **Version**, **Game Version**, or **Supported Versions**.  
   - Pick the version that matches your Minecraft installation (e.g., *1.20.1*, *1.19.2*).

4. **Choose the Correct File Type**  
   The file type depends on the kind of content:  
   - **Mods:** `.jar`  
   - **Plugins:** `.jar`  
   - **Addons (Bedrock):** `.mcaddon` / `.mcpack`  
   - **Texture Packs:** `.zip`  
   - **Data Packs:** `.zip` or extracted folder  
   - **Capes / Skin Addons:** whichever format the creator provides  

5. **Download the File**  
   Click the **Download**, **Get**, or **File** button next to the version you need.  
   Save the file to your device.

6. **Install According to Content Type**  
   - **Mods:** place the `.jar` inside `.minecraft/mods`.  
   - **Plugins:** move the `.jar` into your server’s `plugins` folder.  
   - **Texture Packs:** place the `.zip` into `.minecraft/resourcepacks`.  
   - **Data Packs:** put inside `world/datapacks`.  
   - **Addons (Bedrock):** double-click `.mcaddon` or `.mcpack` to import automatically.  

7. **Restart Minecraft or Your Server**  
   Reload or restart to apply the new content.
short_description: Adds useless achievements to the game by completing meaningless tasks

title: abc: capes
description:
![abc: capes](https://cdn.modrinth.com/data/cached_images/159fa23ba217a3f93a2f860372422bd2466da371.png)
A collection of all official Minecraft capes as well as unused, unobtainable capes and community capes.

On the version page, simply choose your Minecraft version and then select the cape you want to download.

## Step-by-Step Guide

1. **Open the Project Page**  
   Visit the Modrinth, CurseForge, GitHub, or project website for the content you want to download.

2. **Find the Versions or Files Section**  
   Look for a tab or section labelled **Versions**, **Files**, **Releases**, or **Downloads**.

3. **Select Your Minecraft Version**  
   - Locate a list or dropdown called **Version**, **Game Version**, or **Supported Versions**.  
   - Pick the version that matches your Minecraft installation (e.g., *1.20.1*, *1.19.2*).

4. **Choose the Correct File Type**  
   The file type depends on the kind of content:  
   - **Mods:** `.jar`  
   - **Plugins:** `.jar`  
   - **Addons (Bedrock):** `.mcaddon` / `.mcpack`  
   - **Texture Packs:** `.zip`  
   - **Data Packs:** `.zip` or extracted folder  
   - **Capes / Skin Addons:** whichever format the creator provides  

5. **Download the File**  
   Click the **Download**, **Get**, or **File** button next to the version you need.  
   Save the file to your device.

6. **Install According to Content Type**  
   - **Mods:** place the `.jar` inside `.minecraft/mods`.  
   - **Plugins:** move the `.jar` into your server’s `plugins` folder.  
   - **Texture Packs:** place the `.zip` into `.minecraft/resourcepacks`.  
   - **Data Packs:** put inside `world/datapacks`.  
   - **Addons (Bedrock):** double-click `.mcaddon` or `.mcpack` to import automatically.  

7. **Restart Minecraft or Your Server**  
   Reload or restart to apply the new content.

title: Nostalgic
description:
![Nostalgic Craft](https://cdn.modrinth.com/data/cached_images/755b88892a6022cb94ffecfe53f7230690236773.png)  
Nostalgic Craft rebuilds the charm, simplicity, and atmosphere of early Beta Minecraft—enhanced with modern improvements for a smoother, more immersive experience.

## Key Features

- **Beta-Inspired World Generation** — Classic terrain shapes, simple biome layouts, and the iconic Beta exploration feel.  
- **Old Combat Mechanics** — Fast-paced swordplay with no attack cooldowns and a more retro survival flow.  
- **Classic Audio & Textures** — Refined versions of early Minecraft sounds and visuals to recapture the original atmosphere.  
- **Modern Stability** — Performance boosts, QoL tweaks, configuration options, and extended world height—without breaking the nostalgic style.  
- **Multiplayer Friendly** — Fully tuned to deliver the cooperative, survival-focused spirit of Beta gameplay with modern server stability.

## Q&A

**Why play this instead of the actual Beta?**  
This pack offers modern mod support, improved performance, QoL features, higher world limits, stability fixes, and customisation options unavailable in legacy versions.

**Which Beta version inspired the pack?**  
Nostalgic Craft takes heavy inspiration from **Beta 1.3**, blending its atmosphere with modern enhancements.

**Is fog adjustable?**  
Yes — toggle fog density with **F6**.

## Coming Soon

| Feature | Description | Status |
|--------|-------------|--------|
| Config Menu | Full client/server settings for Beta options and tweaks. | Planned |
| Custom Fog Profiles | Switch between multiple fog styles inspired by early versions. | Planned |
| Additional Retro Assets | More sounds, textures, and ambience from the Beta era. | In Progress |
| Optional Hotbar & HUD Styles | Classic interface variants with toggle options. | Planned |
| Multiplayer Enhancements | Extra settings for servers recreating Beta survival. | Planned |
| Extra Worldgen Tweaks | More Beta-like structures, caves, and terrain noise profiles. | Planned |


## Step-by-Step Guide

1. **Open the Project Page**  
   Visit the Modrinth, CurseForge, GitHub, or project website for the content you want to download.

2. **Find the Versions or Files Section**  
   Look for a tab or section labelled **Versions**, **Files**, **Releases**, or **Downloads**.

3. **Select Your Minecraft Version**  
   - Locate a list or dropdown called **Version**, **Game Version**, or **Supported Versions**.  
   - Pick the version that matches your Minecraft installation (e.g., *1.20.1*, *1.19.2*).

4. **Choose the Correct File Type**  
   The file type depends on the kind of content:  
   - **Mods:** `.jar`  
   - **Plugins:** `.jar`  
   - **Addons (Bedrock):** `.mcaddon` / `.mcpack`  
   - **Texture Packs:** `.zip`  
   - **Data Packs:** `.zip` or extracted folder  
   - **Capes / Skin Addons:** whichever format the creator provides  

5. **Download the File**  
   Click the **Download**, **Get**, or **File** button next to the version you need.  
   Save the file to your device.

6. **Install According to Content Type**  
   - **Mods:** place the `.jar` inside `.minecraft/mods`.  
   - **Plugins:** move the `.jar` into your server’s `plugins` folder.  
   - **Texture Packs:** place the `.zip` into `.minecraft/resourcepacks`.  
   - **Data Packs:** put inside `world/datapacks`.  
   - **Addons (Bedrock):** double-click `.mcaddon` or `.mcpack` to import automatically.  

7. **Restart Minecraft or Your Server**  
   Reload or restart to apply the new content.
short_description: A nostalgic modpack that recreates early Beta Minecraft’s charm and simplicity.
author: unknown

title: Better essentials
description:
![Better essentials](https://cdn.modrinth.com/data/cached_images/2b675ff1cfd131cf055806a60b32ac6e63e0c2e7.png)

A lightweight modpack that improves the functionality of the [Essential](https://modrinth.com/mod/essential) mod and adds small optimisation upgrades for smoother gameplay. It keeps things simple while making Minecraft easier, faster, and more efficient to play.
short_description: A lightweight modpack that improves the functionality of the Essential mod and adds small optimisation upgrades for smoother gameplay.
author: unknown

title: Soft Ember Items
description:
![Soft Ember Items](https://cdn.modrinth.com/data/cached_images/7d21d572f66729efff348ac67f1e1ea76e63f5a8.png)
Soft Ember Items adds subtly glowing, ember-tipped consumables to Minecraft.

## Configuration (not yet added)

Server owners and pack creators can optionally tweak effects, durations, or disable certain items entirely for a tailored experience.

## Compatibility

Soft Ember Items is designed to work smoothly with most content mods, texture packs, and datapacks. It requires no dependencies unless specified for your version.

## Coming soon

| Feature | Description | Status |
|--------|-------------|-----|
| Custom Particles | Add unique ember and smoke particle effects. | Added |
| Status Effects | Introduce light buffs or debuffs when consuming items. |
| Crafting Overhaul | Expand recipes using new ember-infused materials. |
| Decorative Variants | Add placeable decorative ember items for builds. |
| Custom Sounds | Implement soft crackle and ember-burning audio. |
| Durability System | Introduce limited-use consumables with wear. |
| Villager Trades | Add ember items to specific villager trade pools. |
| Advancement Set | Unlock themed advancements and challenges. |
| Config Menu | Full client/server config for balance and toggles. |
| Compatibility Support | Integrate with popular mods and resource packs. |
| Environmental Interactions | Ember items react to rain, water, or wind. |
| Glow Colour Variants | Add different ember glow colours and rarities. |


## Step-by-Step Guide

1. **Open the Project Page**  
   Visit the Modrinth, CurseForge, GitHub, or project website for the content you want to download.

2. **Find the Versions or Files Section**  
   Look for a tab or section labelled **Versions**, **Files**, **Releases**, or **Downloads**.

3. **Select Your Minecraft Version**  
   - Locate a list or dropdown called **Version**, **Game Version**, or **Supported Versions**.  
   - Pick the version that matches your Minecraft installation (e.g., *1.20.1*, *1.19.2*).

4. **Choose the Correct File Type**  
   The file type depends on the kind of content:  
   - **Mods:** `.jar`  
   - **Plugins:** `.jar`  
   - **Addons (Bedrock):** `.mcaddon` / `.mcpack`  
   - **Texture Packs:** `.zip`  
   - **Data Packs:** `.zip` or extracted folder  
   - **Capes / Skin Addons:** whichever format the creator provides  

5. **Download the File**  
   Click the **Download**, **Get**, or **File** button next to the version you need.  
   Save the file to your device.

6. **Install According to Content Type**  
   - **Mods:** place the `.jar` inside `.minecraft/mods`.  
   - **Plugins:** move the `.jar` into your server’s `plugins` folder.  
   - **Texture Packs:** place the `.zip` into `.minecraft/resourcepacks`.  
   - **Data Packs:** put inside `world/datapacks`.  
   - **Addons (Bedrock):** double-click `.mcaddon` or `.mcpack` to import automatically.  

7. **Restart Minecraft or Your Server**  
   Reload or restart to apply the new content.
short_description: Soft Ember Items adds subtly glowing, ember-tipped consumables to Minecraft.

title: XYZ: FPS essentials
description:
![fps](https://cdn.modrinth.com/data/cached_images/965279c51d2396922daf768abace4a04c2af2b5c.png)
A modpack featuring the community’s most reliable FPS boosters, focused purely on smoother performance and better stability.

| Mod Name        | Link                                   |
|-----------------|-----------------------------------------|
| Sodium          | https://modrinth.com/mod/sodium         |
| Lithium         | https://modrinth.com/mod/lithium        |
| Iris            | https://modrinth.com/mod/iris           |
| Entity Culling  | https://modrinth.com/mod/entityculling  |
| Dynamic FPS | https://modrinth.com/mod/dynamic-fps |
